xLT0YdBJ9rFF8gCiW4BeOg.text: Good food. Nice room. Very good service.  Not overly formal.  Classic French with everything well executed.  Table d'hote menu available.  Would definitely return. Recommended.

kcYkEogqKglDAuNdh57LtQ.text: Tourista's observation: Solid French Brasserie food in Edinburgh! If you are staying in New Town, probably using AirBnB, Cote Brasserie is a very good option for Breakfast, Lunch, or Dinner. Easy to get into without reservations!!! Great location easy to get to by walking or taxi/uber. Cute ambiance(yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...) with a very french bistro feel (thus the name). We ate breakfast here once and had dinner as well. Service is very good: polite and efficient Breakfast options of Scottish Salmon and eggs (yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...) Full breakfast (yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...) Vegetarian breakfast (yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...) All of these breakfast options were fantastic and moderately priced. Dinners are just as good: Appetizers of Asparagus (yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...), Baked goat cheese (yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...), Steak tartar..talk about classic bistro food! (yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...), And Chicken Liver parfait with toast points (yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...)... All were exceptionally well crafted, well plated and simply delicious Entrees were nonetheless exceptional: Fish Parmentier was something I had never heard of before...yes sure the ubiquitous Hachis Parmentier. However it was really great. (yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...) I opted for a french version of fish and chips and was not let down (yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...) Even a simple chicken dish turned out to be a wonderful surprise of super fresh and very unique ingredients (yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...) Simple but good wine list offering nice french wines (yelp.com/biz_photos/cote...) If I were back in Edinburgh I would dine here again no exception!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cote Brasserie - Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. corn fed chicken reared in the heart of rural Brittany in the west of France which is renowned for its poultry
Photo of Cote Brasserie - Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish Parmentier cod, haddock, prawn and salmon in a creamy white wine, leek sauce, topped with mash potato and Gruyère cheese
Photo of Cote Brasserie - Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken Liver Parfait  chicken liver pâté with toasted brioche and spiced apple chutney

B0YsHGfZQGtyx2KcS0rvxQ.text: Even though this is considered a "chain" it was an amazing meal. We got there before 7om and had there 3 courses for 14 pounds . My appetizer was langoustines popcorn style with a delicious sauce. My friend had the artichoke hearts to die for. For the entrees I had the most delicious sea bass with mash and fennel salad . My friend had a really tasty steak frites . Then the deserts ! Chocolate mousse and chocolate pot - wonderful . To top it all of, delicious full bodied red for 22 pounds. Service was terrific !

HBQjZ2UC_DeNiFdfu_2Z8Q.text: Food and service were great. Such a deal with the breakfast with hot and cold drinks! It was a great way to spend my last morning on holiday in Scotland

-r88tsqPfuYt-2QVpnbw-g.text: Lovely bistro in the centre of town. Good quality, tasty French fare.  Faultless service. Could easily become a firm favourite in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Cote Brasserie - Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Cote Brasserie - Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

NrxFJYgytt1fFqntEsdCtg.text: Good food, Warm Ambience, slow food service and the serving team needs improvement. One of their servers named JUSTINE is racist and won't take our orders even though she was stationed to our table. Our family arrived at 6:20pm but our food (starters)was served 7:05pm, we've notified beforehand that we were to see the ballet at 7:30pm.

VEYAx14Jw8p2joAa070TNg.text: During our visit to Edinburgh we had breakfast twice at Cote Brasserie.  I had the Crepe Complete both times because it was so delicious.  The restaurant is lovely, the staff are friendly, and the location in New Town was great- within walking distance of our hotel and many others.  I definitely recommend Cote Brasserie.

photos.caption: Photo of Cote Brasserie - Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Crepe Complete. Delicious.

VF7yvzTdEKfGk2qEun2XrQ.text: obviously I haven't been to every breakfast place in the UK but I'd imagine it's hard to beat the service and value at Cote. I've been to many with fancy schmancy ingredients and etc but the service and food you get at Cote for 10 freakin pounds BLOWS me away.   also I had no clue till later it was a chain but I dont get that feel at all!  you can get a few different breakfasts include a fill e flush breakfast PLUS hot drink, a juice, and filtered water all for 10. however what blows me away is the level of service at the various locations ive been to. its very applicated but approachable. j truly feel the experience and food allow it to charge 1.5x more in my opinion. you may think it's questionable food for that price but it's actually legit. they put chives in the eggs and even the butter is SOFT not frozen.   also I get a croissant now and they warm it up which is like crack. it's so good by itself.   i love this place and could only imagine a place like the four seasons London could beat but overall value I doubt it can be beat.  JEANS: OK by far ORDER: at table

j2bqQdWfpbuQdUlA4WprYQ.text: Okay so this is part of a chain but it at least has a bit of style about it, as well as providing good quality French food with good service.  The fact that its three courses for 13.95 menu lasts until 19:00 also makes it worth a visit after work without having to rush to get in before 17:00.

iiIX_8EMh52KkmLht9CMxw.text: Staying on Thistle street and being a total Francophile , we were thrilled to see 4 french restaurants within 1 block.  We have now tried two, the others being booked.  You can guess from this review that Cote was one of them.    I am completely genuine when I say it is one of the best meals I have had.  We came two nights in a row.    Me: French onion soup. -perfect ; salmon - absolutely perfect (try cooking salmon and avoiding it being completely dry); order of french fries shared with husband - perfect  Husband: French onion soup; yesterday - linguini with seafood - perfect consistency ; today - prime rib no bone (perfect).  His birthday, so we got creme brule - perfect.  Need I say more?  I am not sure we can stay away tomorrow - it is that good.  Oh, by the way, the service is impeccable.  I am not sure I would expect this if I came at the highest season, August.  Go here, you ill not regret it.

6_t6wYSeyVuwKKWzu_ZLiA.text: Great place for breakfast! Something for everyone- just want a pastry and coffee? Full breakfast?  Nice place with convenient New Town location, good service, good food, good coffee, reasonably priced.

UWm__XSLDM3fRVLdOX7O8w.text: Good coffee, great service. Delicious breakfast! I had the vegetarian breakfast, my mom had the Benedict Florentine and my sister had the breakfast crepe. We would definitely come here again.

N6oHmf0-svwrLpXaKiYvGQ.text: Please do not miss Cote while in Edinburgh.  The food was amazing and the staff charming.  There with a girlfriend and we can not say enough good things.  Started with flatbread and cheese (simplified description), then the risotto and the veal, and DO NOT FORGET the Creme Caramel. Suggested wine selections were fantastic.  The wait staff was knowledgeable, helpful, and patient; 5 stars just for them.  Will return soon (tomorrow).  Remember, the Creme Caramel.

M7ztLO824tfzxNdOvzsRkg.text: After settling in to our AirBnB on Thistle Street, my wife & I started strolling the neighborhood for a place to eat an early-ish dinner on Saturday night when we came across This restaurant. It was not yet busy, which worked for us since we had no reservations.  We were greeted promptly and taken to a table towards the rear of the restaurant.   The list of wines revealed nothing that we were familiar with, so our waiter suggested a bottle of Viognier that we took. It was a good wine for us...not too dry. We also ordered bread & butter. The bread was a warm, soft sourdough that was excellent.   My wife ordered the chicken with garlic butter and a side of creamed spinach. I had some of the chicken and found it to be quite tasty even without the garlic butter, which added a very good complimentary taste. The creamed spinach was quite different with a bit of Pernod added (if I remember correctly).  It was very unique.   I had the fish parmentier. It was very good, although the portion seemed to be on the small side. The dish had been baked in the oven to finish it giving the potatoes a nice golden color that was appealing.   We had the crepe grand marnier for dessert. It was very good.  Our waiter lit the grand marnier when he served it, which was a neat presentation.   Overall, the service was good.  Our waiter was attentive without being overbearing, which enabled us to have some good long conversations. The ambiance was welcoming...soft music in the background, and not too loud. When we left the restaurant, it was very crowded and much louder, but not to the point where we had to shout to hear each other.

X3l7LHxvn8vUKzpCD4H2Eg.text: This is a cute little chain place. I had the special August menu consisting cod goujons (croquets), steak frites and a peach crumble dessert. The starter was pretty much tasteless. The steak was thin and tough. I finished only half of it. The fries were very good. Service was a bit slow and confused. The server didn't notice, or didn't care that I ate only half of the steak. He forgot to serve the dessert. By the time we got his attention, we had to leave. It may have been fantastic, but I'll never know. I won't go back even though I'm staying across the street.

d9nQwIAGlJr_L3GiQeIdCw.text: Not a bad little place. Very clean and organized, plus decently priced but the food didn't wow me and the server, while very professional, also seemed a little distant. It wasn't a bad experience but with so many other options I probably wouldn't go a second time.

HSKXIYHYntJDed_XLDbqqA.text: Wonderful atmosphere, great breakfast! Their gluten free bread is delicious and they pack eggs to perfection. Grateful to find this place! The window table was fun for people watching. This place is worth the money.

yjtB1PMdS3E_ofKl-yhNdg.text: The service was great! The team was helpful and cheerful. The desserts were a perfect finish.  They offer breakfast too so I'd be interested in trying it it

dy7iClUKDHTeqcxG4JRq7A.text: Newly opened. Tired of pub food we stopped by for an early dinner.  Scored a deal with 2 courses for prix fixed price. Choices from regular menu were outstanding and not too expensive including the duck Outstanding food, personable service. Excellent selections of wines by the glass and finished with a bit of whisky as our closer. Highly recommended great food for reasonable price
